org.flexiblepower.api.efi.bufferhelper

Class Buffer<Q extends javax.measure.quantity.Quantity>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.flexiblepower.api.efi.bufferhelper.Buffer<Q>
  • Type Parameters:
    Q - The quantity that describes what is stored in the buffer (e.g. temperature or electricity).

    public class Buffer<Q extends javax.measure.quantity.Quantity>
extends java.lang.Object
    This class processes EFI messages: (buffer registration, system description and update messages). It offers helper methods for the agent to make bids.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Buffer(BufferRegistration<Q> br)
      A Buffer may only be constructed from a complete BufferRegistration message.

    • Method Detail

      • processSystemDescription

        public void processSystemDescription(BufferSystemDescription bsd)
        BufferSystemDescription message's information is copied to the internal model of the buffer.
        Parameters:
        bsd - The buffer system description message.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When the ActuatorId in the BufferSystemDescription is not known

      • processStateUpdate

        public void processStateUpdate(BufferStateUpdate<Q> bsu)
        BufferStateUpdate information is added to the internal model.
        Parameters:
        bsu - The BufferStateUpdate message.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Throws when the ActuatorId, RunningModeId or timerId is not known.

      • getElectricalActuators

        public java.util.List<BufferActuator<Q>> getElectricalActuators()
        Checks all the actuators for those of type electricity and returns them in an ArrayList.
        Returns:
        A list of all electrical BufferActuators or an empty list if none are found.

      • getElectricalActuatorMap

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,BufferActuator<Q>> getElectricalActuatorMap()
        Checks all the actuators for those of type electricity and returns them in an ArrayList.
        Returns:
        A Map of all electrical BufferActuators or an empty list if none are found. The key is the Actuator Id.

      • getCurrentFillFraction

        public double getCurrentFillFraction()
                              throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                                     java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Gets the fill level of the buffer relative to the maximum and minimum fill level. It is expressed in the fill level unit that is defined in the registration message.
        Returns:
        The fill fraction computed where 0 is minimum and 1 is the maximum fill level. May be bigger than 1 or smaller than 0 (when circumstances cause the buffer temperature to go out of the bounds of the minimum and maximum).
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When minimum fill level is greater than or equal to the maximum fill level, this throws.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - When no information is available yet about the state of the buffer.

      • getCurrentFillLevel

        public javax.measure.Measurable<Q> getCurrentFillLevel()
                                                                                        throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Gets the current fill level of the buffer. May be outside of the 'official' range of the running modes.
        Returns:
        A Measurable object containing the current fill level of the buffer and quantity information.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - When no state update has been received.

      • hasReceivedSystemDescription

        public boolean hasReceivedSystemDescription()
        Returns whether this Buffer has received a system description or not yet.
        Returns:
        Whether this buffer has received a system description yet.

      • hasReceivedStateUpdate

        public boolean hasReceivedStateUpdate()
        Returns whether a state update has been received.
        Returns:
        Whether it has received state update.

      • getMinimumFillLevel

        public double getMinimumFillLevel()
                           throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        For a heat pump, minimum fill level is the lowest temperature of the buffer. For a freezer, minimum fill level is the lowest temperature of the freezer.
        Returns:
        The minimum of all actuators, not only the electrical.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - When no system description has been received, this throws.

      • getMaximumFillLevel

        public double getMaximumFillLevel()
                           throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Returns:
        The maximum of all actuators, not only the electrical.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException

      • getAllocationDelay

        public javax.measure.Measurable<javax.measure.quantity.Duration> getAllocationDelay()
        Gets the allocation delay.
        Returns:
        A Measurable that represents the allocation delay as a duration.
